text: Having issues trying to re submit my theme. Says there is an error in my css file, but when I click through there is nothing....

Thanks <@U3T21PDBK>! The way HubSpot handles images makes them frequently blurry, so I was trying to avoid that if at all possible. I wish we had more control over how we load images, the automatic thing isn’t great when it doesn’t work right.
FWIW, we use custom image modules in our theme and we take complete control over it
Thanks yup ended up adding the button code directly into the Theme module. A slight bummer the code will have to maintained in 2 places but hey it could be worse.

Not sure if you're using the boilerplate or if you added fields to the theme settings. The theme settings data still has to be incorporated into a CSS file. with the boilerplate, the theme-overrides.css file is a good place to start. 2) Theme changes made in the theme editor have to be published. Did you click the publish button in the top right?

While I like aspects of the new Theme system, code duplication seems to be a challenge.  Making things easier for Marketers in the page editor leads to duplication of modules if you have multiple themes. I added an Idea to the community for sub-themes. Help get it moving by giving it a vote. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Sub-Themes-as-a-way-to-share-assets/idi-p/359420>
